benchmark_details.name: ZOGRASCOPE
benchmark_details.overview: ZOGRASCOPE is a benchmark designed specifically for property graphs and queries written in Cypher, including a diverse set of manually annotated queries of varying complexity, organized into three partitions: iid, compositional, and length.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a resource for advancing research in semantic parsing over property graphs and to evaluate the performance of semantic parsers.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset does not currently include complex query patterns such as nested sub-queries.

data.source: Built from an open-access crime investigation graph using Cypher queries.
data.annotation: Each example is manually annotated by experts.

methodology.calculation: A prediction is deemed correct if it yields identical results to the reference query when executed on the knowledge graph.
methodology.interpretation: Performance improves as more supervision is provided; zero-shot setting performs poorly but accuracy improves with added examples.
methodology.baseline_results: Fine-tuning achieved the best performance for each of the models tested.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Sensitive information has been removed and replaced with fictitious content.
